mmaracic.gameaiframework

Class PacmanVisibleWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • mmaracic.gameaiframework.PacmanVisibleWorld

  • public final class PacmanVisibleWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that describes the surroundings of the agent. It is possible to get a list of world objects at each element of the surroundings as well as the metadata that the agent left there

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDimensionX()
      Method returns the diameter od the surroundings in the x direction
      int getDimensionY()
      Method returns the diameter od the surroundings in the y direction
      java.util.ArrayList<WorldEntity.WorldEntityInfo> getWorldInfoAt(float x, float y)
      Method returns the list of information objects regarding entities that reside at a visible location in the agent's surroundings.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> getWorldMetadataAt(float x, float y)
      Method returns the map of objects left by the friendly agents at the particular visible location in the agent's surroundings (even a wall).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getDimensionX

        public final int getDimensionX()
        Method returns the diameter od the surroundings in the x direction
        Returns:
        Diameter od the surroundings in the x direction

      • getDimensionY

        public final int getDimensionY()
        Method returns the diameter od the surroundings in the y direction
        Returns:
        Diameter od the surroundings in the y direction

      • getWorldInfoAt

        public final java.util.ArrayList<WorldEntity.WorldEntityInfo> getWorldInfoAt(float x,
                                                              float y)
        Method returns the list of information objects regarding entities that reside at a visible location in the agent's surroundings. Returns null for invisible locations. Location 0,0 is the location of the agent.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the world location; range: -dimensionX/2...0...dimensionX/2
        y - y-coordinate of the world location; range: -dimensionY/2...0...dimensionY/2
        Returns:
        List of information objects about all the world entities at that location

      • getWorldMetadataAt

        public final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> getWorldMetadataAt(float x,
                                                                       float y)
        Method returns the map of objects left by the friendly agents at the particular visible location in the agent's surroundings (even a wall). Returns null for invisible locations. Location 0,0 is the location of the agent. Modifications on both yours and your friends metadata are written back. Each agent can have only one object at a metadata position. Any new object will overwrite the old one of the same agent. Integer key is the ID of the agent. Any invalid keys and their values will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the world location range: -dimensionX/2...0...dimensionX/2
        y - y-coordinate of the world location range: -dimensionY/2...0...dimensionY/2
        Returns:
        Hashmap of objects containig the metadata left by the agents. It is up to the agents to define the form of the metadata. ID of the agent is the key of the map.
